result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Patrick Bauer

records.addlTxt: Competency Report attached to Cover sheet for Confidential Records
Competency hearing on November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:31 AM Defendant Shawn Patrick Bauer appeared by zoom technology by video along Attorney Zebulon Patek by phone.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. State has visited with Mr. Patek this morning and he has information he wishes to share with the Court.  Mr. Patek raises competency and requests an evaluation.  Court will order an evaluation and have a hearing after we have a report.  Court will waive TL for PH in 22CF34.  No objection by Atty Patek or Mr. Bauer.  22CF28 will track along with this case.  Mr. Patek asks the competency issue apply to all files.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:50 PM Defendant Shawn Patrick Bauer not in court.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Patrick Bauer, Shawn's father and Marcia Bauer, Shawn's mother appear in the courtroom and report Shawn Bauer doesn't think there is any charges against him.  We are asking he be committed and ask for help.  Court refers you to the DHS.  On 8/26 Shawn Bauer appeared in Court, was informed of his charges and rights and given AIA today at 1:30 p.m. and he FTA.  Warrant requested by the State.  State willing to hold issuance if his parents can get him help.  Court will authorize warrant and hold off signing it until Monday 9/12.

No contact with DM or his residence W8246 Sylvester Rd, Arkansaw, WI; 
Take prescribed medications based on the doctors prescription and direction.

2:04 PM Defendant Shawn Patrick Bauer appeared by phone.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant of charges in criminal complaint/max. penalties and rights. Mr. Seifert notes Mr. Bauer's significant criminal history, battery in 2020 and the victim is the same victim in the burglary in this case, other prior convictions noted.  State request $2500 signature bond with condition:  No contact with DM or his residence W8246 Sylvester Rd, Arkansaw; take prescribed medications based on the doctors prescription and direction.  Mr. Bauer's concurs the bond condition.  Court orders bond as stated by Mr. Seifert.  Mr. Bauer will contact the PD office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
